item.title: Get Insulted by sudo
item.author: Author
item.description: Do you know sudo can insult you? wait, what â“ ðŸ˜• Take a look at what I’m talking about. sudo can insult you for typing incorrect password. ðŸ’¥ Enable insults in sudo Open a terminal and type: $ sudo visudo This should open the configuration file in your default editor. In ubuntu like distros, it will be opened in nano. Now you will have to find the section where the defaults are listed.

item.title: Command Aliases in Ubuntu Linux
item.author: Author
item.description: How to set up alias in Linux Every time I need to see different projects logs from application servers logs folder from different terminal window,Â I have to go to Weblogic’s logs folder and then open the log file using less or tail -f project-name.logÂ cd /home/rimonmostafiz/Applications/Oracle/Middleware/Oracle_Home/user_projects/domains/base_domain/logs/ less project-name.log orÂ tail -f project-name.log I don’t want to write this long string Everytime,Â Wouldnâ€™t it be easier to just type something like the following?

item.title: Oracle SQL Developer in Ubuntu
item.author: Author
item.description: You will need a free Oracle account to log in and download SQL Developer fromÂ OracleÂ Technology NetworkÂ site. For ubuntu download the Other PlatformsÂ version. At the time of writing this post, I download version isÂ sqldeveloper-17.2.0.188.1159-no-jre.zip. You will also need Java to run Oracle SQL developer. After download, I moved the download file toÂ /home/rimonmostafiz/Applications (you can choose any other location you prefer). Move the download file toÂ /home/rimonmostafiz/Applications.

item.title: Google Drive in Ubuntu
item.author: Author
item.description: At the time of writing, there is no official Google Drive client for Ubuntu or Linux Mint but if you need to use it then there is an unofficial client called Grive2.Â Grive is a Google Drive client for GNU/Linux systems. It allows the synchronization of all your files on the cloud with a directory of your choice and the upload of new files to Google Drive. Those of you used Google Drive client on Windows or Mac, Grive2 will do the same for you in Ubuntu or Linux Mint.
